page.title: 07HOME LIFE IN SOUTH LINCS
page.content: In this rural area there is a variety of pastimes and hobbies such as painting, upholstery, bee-keeping, gardening, dog-breeding, reading, flower-arranging, caravanning and photography. One farmer's wife specialises in a chine supper, the chine is stuffed with parsley, enclosed in a chine bag and boiled. Parsley meat loaf is another dish made from minced lean beef, parsley and the remains of the Christmas ham. Another favourite is a Lincolnshire pork pie. Wine-making is a popular hobby, sloe gin, blackberry brandy and elderflower champagne are made.
